actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Reported to House from the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service with amendment, H. Rept. 95-284.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #430 (373-37).
Referred to Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Governmental Affairs with amendment, S. Rept. 95-1080.
House agreed to Senate amendments with amendments.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: An Act to amend subchapter III of chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code, to provide that employees who retire after 5 years of service, in certain instances, may be eligible to retain their life and health insurance benefits, and for other purposes.

summary.as: House agreed to Senate amendment with amendment
summary.text: (House agreed to Senate amendments with amendments) Provides that life and health insurance coverage of insured Federal employees who retire on an immediate annuity, or become entitled to receive workmen's compensation and are determined to be unable to return to duty may be continued if they have been insured for five years or from the first opportunity to elect coverage if less than five years. Sets forth the effective date as the date of enactment of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend subchapter III of chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code, to provide that employees who retire after 5 years of service, in certain instances, may be eligible to retain their life and health insurance benefits.

An Act to amend subchapter III of chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code, to provide that employees who retire after 5 years of service, in certain instances, may be eligible to retain their life and health insurance benefits, and for other purposes.
